text.text: Northern Ireland Politics | Latest News & Updates | BBC News Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK Africa Asia Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics First minister faces more questions over DUP mayor portrait damage First Minister Michelle O'Neill says she was "confident" in the actions she had taken. 3 days ago Northern Ireland Politics Justice minister disagrees devolution has failed policing PSNI Chief Constable Jon Boutcher says devolution has simply not worked for policing in Northern Ireland. 3 days ago Northern Ireland Politics Grid charge changes set to make going green easier Consumers and businesses will pay for the kit needed to connect their own property and any grid reinforcement will become a social charge. 26 Nov 2025 Northern Ireland Sinn Féin MLA's son denies damaging DUP mayor portrait The son of Sinn Féin's Carál Ní Chuilín has denied being involved in damage to a portrait of a former Belfast lord mayor. 8 days ago Northern Ireland Benefit fraud in Northern Ireland rises to £233m, says minister The communities minister is pushing for a crackdown on benefit fraud as the Treasury allows NI to keep some of the savings. 6 days ago Northern Ireland Extra money for NI not 'meeting the demand', says minister Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced an extra £370m for Northern Ireland in the Autumn Budget on Wednesday. 7 days ago Northern Ireland 'We work hard, you want to get the best out of it' - Budget minimum wage rise welcomed With rising costs in recent years, a mum-of-four tells BBC News NI she thinks about household finances constantly. 8 days ago Northern Ireland Alex Maskey portrait unveiled in Stormont The newly unveiled portrait of Alex Maskey will join those of his predecessors on display in Stormont. Sewage spills are the result of 'decades of neglect' How Daera, DfI and the Utility Regulator regulate sewage discharges by NI Water is to be examined. Assembly told portrait damaged by Sinn Féin MLA's son Sinn Féin is accused of covering up whop the alleged attacked is by DUP assembly member Philip Brett. Executive rejects DUP bid to overturn minister's Israel trade block The economy minister previously defended her decision to blocks trade talks with Israel. DUP leader criticises Covid Inquiry chair after damning report Robinson said Baroness Hallett did not put enough weight on how NI parties have to work within a mandatory power-sharing coalition. text.clean_text: News News N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics First minister faces more questions over DUP mayor portrait damage First Minister Michelle O'Neill says she was "confident" in the actions she had taken. 3 days ago Northern Ireland Politics Justice minister disagrees devolution has failed policing PSNI Chief Constable Jon Boutcher says devolution has simply not worked for policing in Northern Ireland. 3 days ago Northern Ireland Politics Grid charge changes set to make going green easier Consumers and businesses will pay for the kit needed to connect their own property and any grid reinforcement will become a social charge. 26 Nov 2025 Northern Ireland Sinn Féin MLA's son denies damaging DUP mayor portrait The son of Sinn Féin's Carál Ní Chuilín has denied being involved in damage to a portrait of a former Belfast lord mayor. 8 days ago Northern Ireland Benefit fraud in Northern Ireland rises to £233m, says minister The communities minister is pushing for a crackdown on benefit fraud as the Treasury allows NI to keep some of the savings. 6 days ago Northern Ireland Extra money for NI not 'meeting the demand', says minister Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced an extra £370m for Northern Ireland in the Autumn Budget on Wednesday. 7 days ago Northern Ireland 'We work hard, you want to get the best out of it' - Budget minimum wage rise welcomed With rising costs in recent years, a mum-of-four tells BBC News NI she thinks about household finances constantly. 8 days ago Northern Ireland Alex Maskey portrait unveiled in Stormont The newly unveiled portrait of Alex Maskey will join those of his predecessors on display in Stormont. Sewage spills are the result of 'decades of neglect' How Daera, DfI and the Utility Regulator regulate sewage discharges by NI Water is to be examined. Assembly told portrait damaged by Sinn Féin MLA's son Sinn Féin is accused of covering up whop the alleged attacked is by DUP assembly member Philip Brett. Executive rejects DUP bid to overturn minister's Israel trade block The economy minister previously defended her decision to blocks trade talks with Israel. DUP leader criticises Covid Inquiry chair after damning report Robinson said Baroness Hallett did not put enough weight on how NI parties have to work within a mandatory power-sharing coalition.
